doc.title: Football Headliners
doc.plot: Highlights from 13 college football games during the 1955 season. It begins in late summer with Georgia Tech versus Miami. We see Maryland beat UCLA; Jim Swink leads TCU over Alabama. Oklahoma beats Texas on its way to an undefeated season and the Orange Bowl. Michigan State beats Paul Horning's Notre Dame; Auburn upsets the Sugar-Bowl-bound Georgia Tech, Maryland beats Syracuse, Navy loses to Notre Dame, and Howard Cassidy leads Ohio State against Wisconsin. Pitt, headed for the Sugar Bowl, beats West Virginia, with the crowd surging on the field too soon. Princeton defeats Yale, Ohio State shuts out Michigan State, with hot tempers on the field. Army's upset of Navy ends the film.
